title: Hi I'm Loote, ask me anything and everything.

embed.description: The latest Tweets from hipster steven (@RiotLoote). I help figure out how to get things done @ Riot Games. American living in Sydney. ign: Loote (OCE) Slytherin for life. snap: coinoperatedboy. Sydney, Australia

body:
Hey friends, 

I'm Loote and I'm a Competitive Operations Manager here at Riot OCE. I spend most of my time thinking about how to get things done and work with our teams here to make it happen! 

I've been at Riot since early 2010. I'm an American living in Sydney, and I've been here for around 2 years now. Before joining Riot I did payroll and employment taxes in the states. I'm very excited that I don't do that anymore. 

I really enjoy a nice beer or a Hendrick's gin & tonic. I spend a lot of my time playing MMO's or League of Legends, or doing Karaoke with friends. I watch a LOT of TV shows, and read a ton of books. I really enjoy fantasy as a genre, my favourite series is actually Harry Potter (I have a Dark Mark tattoo on my forearm). 

My favourite champion varies a lot, right now I'm learning Gnar. Feel free to ask me anything - I'm not shy. 

p.s. I have a glorious beard. Easily the best in the office.

replies.body: Who is your favourite Rioter and why is it Woody Wu?

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Bma,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=cAKf81iP,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-07-22T07:02:47.419+0000)
>
> Who is your favourite Rioter and why is it Woody Wu?

Woody is my favourite Rioter because of his unique ability to never give up. He's been trying to get to Masters the entire time I've known him, and he never loses motivation. It's quite inspiring, almost delusional. ;).
its also quite infectious!

Why do you think BMA have such an obsession with Woody?

How can I grow a beard like yours?

You can't grow a beard like mine - it just isn't possible for you. 

I think that BMA really looks up to Woody and that's why. Though, he is a little obsessed.

1. As a Competitive Operations Manager does that mean you were in charge of the whole Ocean Week Thing? Will we get more events like that in the future? (Sorry I don't understand your job description very well)

2. Do you have any plans to make OCE competitive scene a bigger region with more well known events and stuff? Can you say what they are?

3. Bit of a weird question but... How hard is it to get a job at Riot Games? I'm leaving school soon and it would definitely be cool to work in the gaming industry.

4. Do you know if Riot Games has any plans whatsoever to make a second game?

5. Would it be possible to have some like fun events similar to the URF stuff, where OPL players play with/against NA and EUW players? Just as like a cool publicity and community thing for OCE.

Thanks for doing the questions man, I appreciate it :)

1. I actually manage more internal esports stuff. I help to coordinate a lot of our projects that we're working on - OPL, Finals, etc. A lot of time this is helping people to understand what they are trying to accomplish, how best to get there, and putting them in touch with the right people to ensure that they can be successful. I did help a bit on Ocean Week, but that was a team effort, I just helped a bit here and there. 

2. We definitely have plans and this is something we think a lot about. A great example of what we're looking to accomplish is actually with our OPL Finals at Luna - it'll be a very unique event, and should be quite fun. A lot of what is going on will bring quite a bit of attention, which is a great step along the way of creating a more competitive scene. 

3. It's pretty tough - we're very particular about who we hire. The reality is that when choosing a place to work it's very important to evaluate the company you're working for, just like its important for us to evaluate who we want to hire. If you want to learn more about working at Riot, I highly suggest our website: www.riotgames.com - if you have more specific questions about what your area of study is, etc. I'm happy to chat about that as well. 

4. Well, we are called Riot Game(s). We do have an r&d team, but nothing I really know much about. http://www.riotgames.com/articles/20141012/1549/putting-s-riot-games has a little info. 

5. This is a great idea - I'll bring it up and see what we can come up with. I think there is a big opportunity for things like this!

Thanks for replying! The R&D thing looks interesting, LOL MMO pls? I've been checking the Riot Games careers site quite often but there never seems to be anything in my fields, finance and music :(

Thanks again for interacting with the community I actually love these Q&As so much

Couple of questions:

What is your favourite Radio Head album?
Which band should I get into that isn't mainstream yet?
Which beard oil do you use?

Thanks! <3
If you're a gin fan, try stopping Gin Palace if you are ever in Melbourne or maybe try out Martin MIllers Westbourn Gin, it's the tits.
I'll be in Melbourne pretty soon - I'll definitely check this out! Thanks :D.

If you're learning Gnar, try rushing Blade of the Ruined King in most matchups, or a cleaver or Sunfire for other matchups, or maybe even a Wits End, then after a Blade build into a Sunfire then go cleaver if you need the shred or consider Randuin's or something.

He's sustained in ranged form and bursty in Mega Gnar form and tank gnar can survive long enough to do multiple rotations of his Kit in Mega Gnar form although I do miss the high DPS of his Hyper 3rd attack, all in all I love Gnar and think he's really fun and think it's cool that you're practicing him :)

Grats on the Job at Riot. I don't really know what to ask though, what kind of things are you working on right now or is that classified information? I'd like to see what you deal with at Riot anyway, is it like working on balancing or what lol I don't really know what a competitive operations manager is. Is that working on preparing tournaments and stuff and coming up with ideas for Riot pro play etc?

That's awesome - thanks so much for the tips on Gnar. That actually helps a lot. 

As a competitive operation manager my job is mostly just to get shit done. A lot of it is making sure that we have the right resources, we know who is doing what, we know when it needs to be done, etc. It's a lot of project management, but also quite a bit of supporting whatever team needs some additional help. I'm pretty adaptable and end up doing lots of different things for different people :).

So after games I like to look at the game statistics in the match history and a part of that is looking at the team gold advantage graph, so my problem arises from the fact that I tend to fill which obviously means I play a fair bit of support but as it doesn't show who assists in the kills I find it hard to see where I've actually managed to impact the game. So I feel adding little icons for assists next to the larger kill icon would allow supports to better analyse their games. Does this sound like a good idea or just a meaningless addition which would bring no value?

However, I'm not great at understanding user experiences cases like this (i.e. other than this case where we know it would help us, how would other people use it/how would it make them feel?). I'll ask about this though, as it does intrigue me.

> How does it feel to be in the original ezreal champion spotlight?

1. I started working here mostly because I was very inspired by the premise of being player focused. I didn't put a lot of thought into it at the time, but in hindsight its something I've always felt strongly about. 

2. Ugh, that was actually the first time I had ever played Poppy so I did SOO horribly. At the time we didn't really do much about letting people know they were going into a game where it was a champ spotlight, so I was like "YEAH PLAYTEST, IM GOING TO LEARN POPPY" - in reality I just fed, haha. It was fun though!

> how did you start playing league and why did you wan't a job in Riot, also if you had to choose to be a certain champion which one would it be?

I started playing league back in 2009 as one of my friends from Everquest was playing. At the time I was very heavy into wow, but once my roommates started playing I got hooked. 

I think my first few games I played tank Master Yi, haha

Originally I was playing lots of games while I was working in taxes. A friend was working at Riot and I lived near the office. I actually applied on a whim, but after the interview process I was absolutely sold. Everyone was so passionate and cared so much about what they were doing. I accepted right away :). 

If I had to choose a champion, I would say Ezreal. Easily my most played. He's quite fun.
